intro: Hebeclinium wurdackianum, commonly known as the Wurdack's hebeclinium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive blue to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shrubland habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
